title: Isolate the Quadratic term
text: We minus $$4$$ on both sides to get $$5{\left(x-5\right)}^2$$ isolated by itself which gives $$5{\left(x-5\right)}^2=100$$.
speech: We minus  4  on both sides to get  5 times, parentheses x minus 5,  squared  isolated by itself which gives  5 times, parentheses x minus 5,  squared is equal to 100 .

title: Find Leading Coefficient
pacedSpeech: What's the leading coefficient now?

title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives $${\left(x-5\right)}^2=20$$.
speech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives  parentheses x minus 5,  squared is equal to 20 .
pacedSpeech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives    x minus 5,  squared is equal to 20

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(x-5\right)}^2=20$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$x-5=\sqrt{20}$$ or $$x-5=-\sqrt{20}$$.

title: Simplify the Radical

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$5{\left(x-5\right)}^2+4=104$$ has two solutions which are $$x=5-2\sqrt{5}$$, and $$x=5+2\sqrt{5}$$.
speech: Therefore,  5 times, parentheses x minus 5,  squared plus 4 is equal to 104  has two solutions which are  x, is equal to 5 minus, 2 the square root of 5 , and  x is equal to, 5 plus, 2 the square root of 5 .
